csi:question.csi:qText: List the names and titles of any contributors that assisted in the formulation of the responses:
What is the name of the holding or parent company name?
Is this a public or privately held company?
If Public, what is the name of the Exchange?
If public, what symbol(s) are you trading under?
Type of legal entity and state of incorporation?
How long has the company been in business?
Any there any material claims or judgments against the company?
If Yes, please describe, including any impact it may have on the service being provided to the institution.

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: Which regulator supervises or examines the company? Indicate all that apply:

csi:question.csi:qText: Does the company have an internal audit, risk management or compliance department with responsibility for identifying and tracking resolution of outstanding internal, external or regulatory issues?
What is the name and description(s) of service(s) to be reviewed under shared assessment?

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: Is this a shared service? (A shared service is provided to multiple clients vs. a dedicated service, which is provided only to one client.)

csi:question.csi:qText: Are any aspects of the service outsourced?
If yes, describe what is outsourced, name of the contracted party, whether the outsourced service involves customer information and the country of operation.

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: Has the service been audited in the past year for any of the following?

csi:question.csi:qText: Does the company hire an external audit firm to produce a SAS 70 report on the operations under review?
If no, has another type of assessment or audit been performed? Explain.
Have any of the audits addressed in question 15 and 16 resulted in any exceptions or findings?
What is the production site physical address?
What is the backup site physical address?
Are there any additional location(s) of operations where target data is stored?
If so, provide locations (address, city, state, country).

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: Please provide details in the following areas:

csi:question.csi:qText: Number of employees by function (e.g., development, systems operations, information security)
* Copy of internal or external information security audit report

Information technology and security organization charts (including where information security resides in the organization and the composition of any information security steering committees). Note - Actual names of employees is not required.
Legal clauses and confidentiality templates for third parties
Topics covered in the security training program
* Security incident handling and reporting process
Network configuration diagrams for internal and external networks defined in scope. Note - Sanitized versions of the network diagram are acceptable.
* Internal vulnerability assessments of systems, applications, and networks
* Business Continuity Plan (BCP) and / or Disaster Recovery Plan
* Most recent BCP/DR test dates and results
Does your company have an information security policy?
Has it been approved by executive management?
Has the security policy been published?
Is an owner assigned who is responsible for the maintenance and review of the policy?
Has the security policy been communicated to all constituents?

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: Are the following topics are covered by your policies:

csi:question.csi:qText: Computer and communications systems access and use?
Is there a process in place to review published policies?
Does your company have an Acceptable Use Policy?
Has the policy been reviewed within the last 12 months?
Are there penalties in place for non-compliance with corporate policies?
Is there an information security oversight function that provides clear direction and visible management support for security initiatives within the organization?
Is there an individual or group with responsibility for security within the organization?

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: Does this individual or group have the following responsibilities:

csi:question.csi:qText: Review/Approve Information Security Policies and overall responsibilities
Monitor significant changes in the exposure of information assets
Approve major initiatives to enhance information security
Develop and maintain an overall security plan
Is an individual or group responsible for the implementation / execution of security processes in support of policies?
Is an individual or group responsible for ensuring compliance with security policies.
Are all constituents required to sign confidentiality agreements?
Has there been an independent 3rd party review of the information security program? (If so, note the firm in the "Additional Information" column.)
If so, is there a remediation plan to address findings?

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: Do your contracts with third party service providers who may have access to target data include the following:

csi:question.csi:qText: Right to inspect by relevant regulators
Requirements for dependent service providers located outside of the United States
Is a process in place to regularly monitor your 3rd party service providers to ensure compliance with security standards?
Is an awareness program in place to communicate your security standards and expectations to 3rd party service providers?
Is there a process in place to address any identified issues?
Do you have an independent audit performed on your dependent third parties?
Does your company have an asset management policy?
Has it been approved by executive management?
Has it been communicated to all constituents?
Is an owner assigned who is responsible for the maintenance and review of the policy?
Is an inventory of hardware assets maintained?

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: If so, does the hardware inventory record the following attributes:

csi:question.csi:qText: Is there an inventory of software licenses?
Is ownership assigned for information assets?
If so, is the owner responsible for approving and reviewing access to those information assets?
Does your organization have an information classification policy in place?
Has it been approved by management?
Has it been communicated to all constituents?
Is an owner assigned who is responsible for the maintenance and review of the policy?

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: For each of the following, do documented procedures exist for the treatment and handling of information assets in accordance with its classification:

csi:question.csi:qText: Are documented procedures in place for the disposal and/or destruction of physical media (e.g.: Paper documents, CDs, DVDs, tapes, disk drives, etc.)?
Are documented procedures in place for the reuse of physical media (e.g.: Tapes, disk drives, etc.)?
Does your company have a pre-screening policy?
Has it been approved by management?
Has it been communicated to appropriate constituents?
Is an owner assigned who is responsible for the maintenance and review of the policy?
Does the company use an external background screening agency?

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: Do applicants undergo the following checks:

csi:question.csi:qText: Criminal background check: Information Security Personnel?
Criminal background check: Physical Security Personnel?
Credit background check: Information Security Personnel?
Credit background check: Physical Security Personnel?
Academic / Professional certification check: FT Employees?
Academic / Professional certification check: PT Employees?
Academic / Professional certification check: Temporary Workers?
Academic / Professional certification check: Information Security Personnel?
Academic / Professional certification check: Physical Security Personnel?

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: Are new hires required to accept the following:

csi:question.csi:qText: Acceptable Use Policy: Information Security Personnel?
Acceptable Use Policy: Physical Security Personnel?
Code of Conduct / Ethics: FT Employees?
Code of Conduct / Ethics: PT Employees?
Code of Conduct / Ethics: Temporary Workers?
Code of Conduct / Ethics: Information Security Personnel?
Code of Conduct / Ethics: Physical Security Personnel?
Do constituents participate in security awareness training?
Does your organization's security awareness training include a review of security policies, procedures and processes?
Does your organization's security awareness training include a testing component?
Are constituents required to undergo information security awareness training upon hire?
Are constituents required to undergo information security awareness training at least annually?
Is the security training commensurate with levels of responsibilities and access?
Do constituents responsible for information security undergo additional training?
Are information security personnel required to obtain professional security certifications (e.g., GSEC, CISSP)?

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: Are information security policies and procedures communicated via:

csi:question.csi:qText: intranet or bulletin board: FT Employees?
intranet or bulletin board: PT Employees?
intranet or bulletin board: Temporary Workers?
intranet or bulletin board: Information Security Personnel?
intranet or bulletin board: Physical Security Personnel?
instructor lead training: Information Security Personnel?
instructor lead training: Physical Security Personnel?
web based training: Information Security Personnel?
web based training: Physical Security Personnel?
Physical media (e.g.: paper, CD, etc.): FT Employees?
Physical media (e.g.: paper, CD, etc.): PT Employees?
Physical media (e.g.: paper, CD, etc.): Contractors?
Physical media (e.g.: paper, CD, etc.): Temporary Workers?
Physical media (e.g.: paper, CD, etc.): Information Security Personnel?
Physical media (e.g.: paper, CD, etc.): Physical Security Personnel?

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: Do constituents reaffirm acceptance of the following at least annually:

csi:question.csi:qText: Acceptable Use Policy: Information Security Personnel?
Acceptable Use Policy: Physical Security Personnel?
Code of Conduct / Ethics: FT Employees?
Code of Conduct / Ethics: PT Employees?
Code of Conduct / Ethics: Temporary Workers?
Code of Conduct / Ethics: Information Security Personnel?
Code of Conduct / Ethics: Physical Security Personnel?
Is there a disciplinarily process in place for non-compliance with Corporate Policy?
Does your company have termination policy?
Has it been approved by management?
Has it been communicated to appropriate constituents?
Is an owner assigned who is responsible for the maintenance and review of the policy?
Does your HR department notify security / access administration of termination of constituents?

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: Is this notification of terminations provided:

csi:question.csi:qText: on the actual date of termination?
less than one week of termination date?
one week or greater than termination date?
Does your HR department notify security / access administration of a constituent's change of status?

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: Is this notification of constituent status change provided:

csi:question.csi:qText: on the actual date of change of status?
less than one week of change of status date?
one week or greater than change of status date?
Is there a process in place for the return of assets (laptop, desktop, PDA, cell phones, access cards, tokens, smart cards, keys, proprietary documentation) for terminated constituents?
Is there a process in place for the return of assets (laptop, desktop, PDA, cell phones, access cards, tokens, smart cards, keys, proprietary documentation) for constituents with a change in status?

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: Do the perimeters surrounding the target systems contain the following elements:

csi:question.csi:qText: Motion sensors: External Campus and Loading Area?
Motion sensors: External Campus and Loading Area?
Closed circuit camera pointed at entry points: Immediate?
Closed circuit camera pointed at entry points: Secure?
Closed circuit camera pointed at entry points: General?
Closed circuit camera pointed at entry points: External Campus and Loading Area?
Closed circuit camera pointed at entry points: External Campus and Loading Area?
Anti-tailgating / Piggybacking mechanisms: External Campus and Loading Area?
Anti-tailgating / Piggybacking mechanisms: External Campus and Loading Area?
Missing floor tiles: External Campus and Loading Area?
Missing floor tiles: External Campus and Loading Area?
Windows along perimeter: External Campus and Loading Area?
Windows along perimeter: External Campus and Loading Area?
Glass walls: External Campus and Loading Area?
Glass walls: External Campus and Loading Area?
Walls extending from true floor to true ceiling: Immediate?
Walls extending from true floor to true ceiling: Secure?
Walls extending from true floor to true ceiling: General?
Walls extending from true floor to true ceiling: External Campus and Loading Area?
Walls extending from true floor to true ceiling: External Campus and Loading Area?
Unlocked and unattended system displays and consoles: Immediate?
Unlocked and unattended system displays and consoles: Secure?
Unlocked and unattended system displays and consoles: General?
Unlocked and unattended system displays and consoles: External Campus and Loading Area?
Unlocked and unattended system displays and consoles: External Campus and Loading Area?
Security guards at points of entry: Immediate?
Security guards at points of entry: Secure?
Security guards at points of entry: General?
Security guards at points of entry: External Campus and Loading Area?
Security guards at points of entry: External Campus and Loading Area?
Secured / Locked cabinets: External Campus and Loading Area?
Secured / Locked cabinets: External Campus and Loading Area?
Badge readers at points of entry: Immediate?
Badge readers at points of entry: Secure?
Badge readers at points of entry: General?
Badge readers at points of entry: External Campus and Loading Area?
Badge readers at points of entry: External Campus and Loading Area?
Biometric readers at points of entry: Immediate?
Biometric readers at points of entry: Secure?
Biometric readers at points of entry: General?
Biometric readers at points of entry: External Campus and Loading Area?
Biometric readers at points of entry: External Campus and Loading Area?
Locked doors requiring a key or PIN at points of entry: Immediate?
Locked doors requiring a key or PIN at points of entry: Secure?
Locked doors requiring a key or PIN at points of entry: General?
Locked doors requiring a key or PIN at points of entry: External Campus and Loading Area?
Locked doors requiring a key or PIN at points of entry: External Campus and Loading Area?
Single point of entry: External Campus and Loading Area?
Single point of entry: External Campus and Loading Area?
Fencing / Other barriers: External Campus and Loading Area?
Fencing / Other barriers: External Campus and Loading Area?
External lighting: External Campus and Loading Area?
External lighting: External Campus and Loading Area?
Security patrols: External Campus and Loading Area?
Security patrols: External Campus and Loading Area?
Alarms on exterior doors: External Campus and Loading Area?
Alarms on exterior doors: External Campus and Loading Area?
Prop alarms: External Campus and Loading Area?
Prop alarms: External Campus and Loading Area?
Alarms on windows: External Campus and Loading Area?
Alarms on windows: External Campus and Loading Area?
Do emergency-specific doors only permit external egress?
Are all visitors always escorted when inside the facility?
Are visitors required to sign in and out?

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: Are the following rooms isolated in the facility:
Is a separate level of access required to enter the above areas?

csi:question.csi:qText: Are secured areas created in order to protect offices, rooms and facilities with special security requirements?
Is there a process in place for requesting access to restricted secure areas?
Is there a process in place for approving access to restricted secure areas?
Is there a process in place for granting access to restricted secure areas?
Is a process in place to periodically review access to restricted secure areas?

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: If so, how frequently are user access rights reviewed:

csi:question.csi:qText: Is there a segregation of duties between those responsible for the storage and the granting of access devices (e.g.: badges, keys, etc.)?
Is there segregation of duties in granting and approving access to restricted secure areas?
Is a list maintained of all personnel possessing cards / keys to the data center?
Is a process in place to report lost access cards / keys?
Is a process in place to periodically review access to restricted secure areas

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: Is the retention schedule for these images:

csi:question.csi:qText: Is the facility(ies) that contain the target systems monitored 24x7x365?
Is access restricted to the backup power source?

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: Does the hardware for the target systems in the perimeter contain the following physical elements:

csi:question.csi:qText: Air conditioning unit: External Campus and Loading Area?
Air conditioning unit: External Campus and Loading Area?
Backup generator: External Campus and Loading Area?
Backup generator: External Campus and Loading Area?
Fluid or water sensor: External Campus and Loading Area?
Fluid or water sensor: External Campus and Loading Area?

Heat detector: External Campus and Loading Area?
No exposed piping / plumbing: External Campus and Loading Area?
No exposed piping / plumbing: External Campus and Loading Area?

No visible dampness on floors or ceiling: Secure?

No visible dampness on floors or ceiling: External Campus and Loading Area?

Raised floor: External Campus and Loading Area?

Smoke detector: External Campus and Loading Area?
Thermostat: External Campus and Loading Area?
Thermostat: External Campus and Loading Area?

Uninterruptible Power Supply (UPS): External Campus and Loading Area?

Vibration alarm / sensor: External Campus and Loading Area?
Fire alarm: External Campus and Loading Area?
Fire alarm: External Campus and Loading Area?
Wet fire suppression: External Campus and Loading Area?
Wet fire suppression: External Campus and Loading Area?
Dry fire suppression: External Campus and Loading Area?
Dry fire suppression: External Campus and Loading Area?
Fire extinguishers: External Campus and Loading Area?
Fire extinguishers: External Campus and Loading Area?
Multiple power feeds: External Campus and Loading Area?
Multiple power feeds: External Campus and Loading Area?
Multiple communication feeds: External Campus and Loading Area?
Multiple communication feeds: External Campus and Loading Area?
Emergency power off button: External Campus and Loading Area?
Emergency power off button: External Campus and Loading Area?
Halon suppression button: External Campus and Loading Area?
Halon suppression button: External Campus and Loading Area?
Water pumps: External Campus and Loading Area?
Water pumps: External Campus and Loading Area?
Waterproof barriers: External Campus and Loading Area?
Waterproof barriers: External Campus and Loading Area?

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: Is there a preventive maintenance process for the following? (If yes, indicate the frequency of maintenance in the appropriate columns.)

csi:question.csi:qText: UPS Systems: Every 3 months or less?
Line conditioners: Every 3 months or less?
Surge suppressors: Every 3 months or less?
Security alarms: Every 3 months or less?
Fire alarms: Every 3 months or less?
Water detection systems: Every 3 months or less?
Water detection systems: Between 3 and 6 months?
Water detection systems: Between 6 and 12 months?
Sprinkler systems: Every 3 months or less?
Fire suppression systems: Every 3 months or less?
Fire suppression systems: Between 3 and 6 months?
Fire suppression systems: Between 6 and 12 months?

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: Are the following tested? (If yes, indicate the frequency of testing in the appropriate columns.)

csi:question.csi:qText: UPS Systems: Every 3 months or less?
Line conditioners: Every 3 months or less?
Surge suppressors: Every 3 months or less?
Security alarms: Every 3 months or less?
Redundant power sources: Every 3 months or less?
Redundant power sources: Between 3 and 6 months?
Redundant power sources: Between 6 and 12 months?
Generator load: Every 3 months or less?
Generator run: Every 3 months or less?
Fire alarms: Every 3 months or less?
Water detection systems: Every 3 months or less?
Water detection systems: Between 3 and 6 months?
Water detection systems: Between 6 and 12 months?
Sprinkler systems: Every 3 months or less?
Fire suppression systems: Every 3 months or less?
Fire suppression systems: Between 3 and 6 months?
Fire suppression systems: Between 6 and 12 months?
Are fuel supplies for the generator readily available to ensure uninterrupted service?
Is your facility serviced by redundant power sources?
Is your facility serviced by redundant power grids?
Does your UPS system support N+1?
Does your generator system support N+1?

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: Indicate the proximity to the following for the primary facility that stores target data or is critical to the services being provided. Select the approximate number of miles in the appropriate column.

csi:question.csi:qText: Chemical plants or other hazardous manufacturing or processing facilities: 0 - 10 miles?
Chemical plants or other hazardous manufacturing or processing facilities: 11-20 miles?
Chemical plants or other hazardous manufacturing or processing facilities: 21 - 50 miles?
Chemical plants or other hazardous manufacturing or processing facilities: 51 or greater?
Natural gas, petroleum, or other pipelines: 0 - 10 miles?
Natural gas, petroleum, or other pipelines: 11-20 miles?
Natural gas, petroleum, or other pipelines: 21 - 50 miles?
Natural gas, petroleum, or other pipelines: 51 or greater?
Is the facility located in a 100-year flood zone?
Is the facility located in an urban center or major city?
Has the local fire department verified the facility to ensure it meets fire authority regulations?
Is access to the communication cabling termination areas restricted to authorized employees only?
Are specific requirements in place for company-owned workstations located in public areas?
Do you have a policy for equipment removal?
Is a change management / change control policy in place?
Has it been approved by management?
Has it been communicated to appropriate constituents?
Is an owner assigned who is responsible for the maintenance and review of the policy?

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: Does your change management / change control process require the following:

csi:question.csi:qText: Request, review and approval of proposed changes?

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: Are the following changes to production subject to your change control process:

csi:question.csi:qText: Does your change control process require code reviews by information security prior to the implementation of internally developed applications and / or application updates?
Is the requestor of the proposed change separate from the approver?
Is information security's approval required prior to the implementation of changes?
Is a separation of duties enforced between those approving a change and those implementing the change?
Is the user of a system also responsible for reviewing its audit logs?
Is the segregation of duties established to prevent the user of a system from modifying or deleting its audit logs?
Is the same person responsible for the issuance of physical badges, access cards, and keys also responsible for their storage?
Do developers have the ability to make changes to the production environment?
Is a segregation of duties enforced between those approving access and those implementing the request?

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: If separation of duties is not possible, are the following mitigating controls in place:

csi:question.csi:qText: Are there different source code repositories for production and non-production?
Is the production environment logically segregated from non-production environments?

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: Select the mechanism below that most closely reflects how the production, testing, and development environments are segregated:

csi:question.csi:qText: There are physically separate environments for production and non-production
There are unique operating environments, such as different mainframe regions and virtual machines, for production and non-production
There are logical controls in the application to segregate production and non-production
There is no segregation of production and non-production environments
Will any additional third party vendors have access to target data (consider backup vendors, service providers, equipment support vendors, etc)?

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: If so, are any of the following outsourced to a 3rd party:
Are any of the following outsourced to an offshore 3rd party:

csi:question.csi:qText: Do you have a process in place to review their security prior to engaging their services?
Do you have a process in place to review their security on an ongoing basis?
Do you perform a formal risk assessment of the vendor relationship?
Have they undergone an audit by a reputable independent 3rd party?
Are they required to adhere to applicable company standards?
Have they had a security breach in the last 12 months?
Are confidentiality agreements and/or Non Disclosure Agreements in place?
Are they required to notify you of any changes that might effect services rendered?
Is a capacity management policy in place?
Has it been approved by management?
Has it been communicated to appropriate constituents?
Is an owner assigned who is responsible for the maintenance and review of the policy?

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: Has capacity planning been accomplished to project for:

csi:question.csi:qText: Is a formal review process in place to evaluate new systems, applications, and/or devices that are considered for implementation into the company infrastructure?

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: If so, does this process include the following:

csi:question.csi:qText: Is an anti-virus / malware policy in place?
Has it been approved by management?
Has it been communicated to all constituents?
Is an owner assigned who is responsible for the maintenance and review of the policy?
Does the policy prohibit users from disabling anti-virus software?

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: Has anti-virus software been installed on the following:

csi:question.csi:qText: all mobile devices? (e.g.: PDAs, Blackberrys, Palm Pilots, etc.)
all Unix and Unix-based systems? (e.g.: Linux, Sun Solaris, HP-UX, etc.)
Does a process exist to facilitate emergency anti-virus signature updates?

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: How frequently do systems automatically check for new signature updates?
What is the interval between the availability of the signature update and its deployment:

csi:question.csi:qText: Is on-access / real-time scanning enabled on all workstations?
If not, is a full scan scheduled daily?
Is on-access / real-time scanning enabled on all servers?
If not, is a full scan scheduled daily?
Can a non-administrative user disable anti-virus software?
Do you have a policy surrounding backup of production data?
Has it been approved by management?
Has it been communicated to appropriate constituents?
Is an owner assigned who is responsible for the maintenance and review of the policy?

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: How often do you backup target data:

csi:question.csi:qText: If so, is this at a 3rd party facility?

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: If a 3rd party is used, are contractual obligations in place to address:

csi:question.csi:qText: A process for the secure transport of media?

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: Is a process in place that addresses:
For how long is backup data retained:
Are tests performed regularly to determine:

csi:question.csi:qText: The ability to recover the data?
Is target data encrypted on backup media?
Is access to backup media restricted to authorized personnel only?
Is access to backup media formally requested?
Is access to backup media formally approved?
Is access to backup media logged?
Is every connection to an external network terminated at a firewall?
Are boundary devices configured to prevent communications from unapproved networks?
Are routing protocols configured to use authentication?
Do boundary devices deny all access by default?
Is a process in place to request, approve, log, and review access to networks across boundary devices?
Are boundary traffic events logged to support historical or incident research?

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: Are the following logged for blocked traffic:
Are the following logged on boundary devices:

csi:question.csi:qText: User ID making a configuration change?
Are the logs from boundary devices aggregated to a central server?
Are security patches regularly reviewed and applied to boundary devices as appropriate?
Is there an approval process prior to implementing or installing a network device?
Is communication through the boundary device controlled at both the port and IP address level?
Does your company have a documented standard for the ports allowed through the boundary devices?
Does your company have a documented process for securing and hardening boundary devices?

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: If so, does it address the following items:

csi:question.csi:qText: Are network devices periodically monitored for continued compliance to security requirements?
Do production servers share IP subnet ranges with other networks?
Is a solution in place to prevent unauthorized devices from physically connecting to the internal network?
Are monitoring tools deployed and configured in critical segments to detect compromise of network or boundary device security?
Are internal users required to pass through a content filtering proxy prior to accessing the Internet?
Are internal systems required to pass through a content filtering proxy prior to accessing the Internet?
Is there an approval process to allow the implementation of extranet connections?

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: Who owns the boundary devices and termination points in existing extranets?
Who manages the boundary devices and termination points in existing extranets?

csi:question.csi:qText: Are monitoring tools deployed and configured to detect compromise of network or boundary device security in the extranet?
Do devices owned by your company reside behind your company's firewall?
Do Internet-facing boundary devices block traffic that would allow for configuration changes from external sources?
Do Internet-facing boundary devices block traffic that would allow for degradation or denial of service from external sources?
Are monitoring tools deployed and configured at the point-of-presence to detect compromise of network or boundary device security?
Is the network on which Internet-facing systems reside segregated from the internal network? (i.e.: DMZ)
Is the DMZ limited to only those servers that require access from the Internet?
Are monitoring tools deployed and configured in the DMZ to detect compromise of network or boundary device security?
Is an administrative relay or intermediary system present to initiate any interactive OS level access into DMZ?
Is the DMZ segregated by two physically separate firewalls?
Are the logs for DMZ monitoring tools and DMZ devices stored on the internal network?

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: Are there separate DMZ segments for devices that:

csi:question.csi:qText: only accept traffic initiated from the Internet?
only initiate outbound traffic to the Internet?
both accept and initiate connections to / from the Internet?

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: For incoming file transfers, how long is data stored on the DMZ:

csi:question.csi:qText: Removed via an hourly scheduled process
Removed via a daily scheduled process
Removed via a weekly scheduled process
Is there a separate network segment for endpoints for remote access?
Are systems that manage and monitor the DMZ located in a separate network?
Are the IP address associated with DMZ devices Internet routable?
Do you have a policy in place for Wireless networking?
Has it been approved by management?
Has it been communicated to constituents?
Is an owner assigned who is responsible for the maintenance and review of the policy?
Do you allow the use of wireless networking technology in your organization?
Are access points present on the production environment?
Are access points physically isolated from company-owned networks?
If not, are access points located on a separate network segment?
Is this segment firewalled from the rest of the network?
Do access points filter by MAC address?
Is an approval process in place to use Wireless network devices in the environment?
Are systems using wireless networking in the environment also allowed to connect via a secondary network connection? (e.g.: LAN cable, 2nd wireless, etc.)
Is a Guest Wireless LAN present?
If so, is it segregated from the corporate Wireless LAN?
Are logins via wireless connections logged?

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: If so, what encryption methodology is used?

csi:question.csi:qText: Do you regularly scan your organization's facilities for rogue wireless access points?

Is approval required prior to connecting any outbound or inbound modem lines, cable modem lines, and/or DSL phone lines to a desktop or other access point directly connected to the company-managed network?
Is there a list of authorized analog lines within the organization's facilities?
Are modems ever set to auto-answer?

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: If auto-answer is enabled,

csi:question.csi:qText: Does the modem utilize an authentication or encryption device?
Is the modem attached to a host that is physically and logically isolated from the company network?
Is the modem solely capable of receiving facsimile (fax) transmissions?
Is the modem set to call back?
If so, do these logs include caller identification?
Does the company regularly perform war-dialing on all analog lines to detect unauthorized modems?
Is a reputable Network Intrusion Detection System in place?

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: If so, is it in place on the following network segments:

csi:question.csi:qText: Is it configured to generate alerts in case of incidents and values exceeding normal thresholds for your environment?
Is there a formal process in place to regularly update the IDS signatures based on new threats and changes in your environment?
Is the system monitored 24x7x365 by knowledgeable and trained personnel?
In the event of a NIDS functionality failure, is an alert generated?
Does the NIDS inspect encrypted traffic?
Does NIDS events feed into the Incident Management process?
Is a reputable Network Intrusion Prevention System in place?

Between the DMZ and internal network?

Do you prevent the automatic forwarding of email messages?

Is an email filtering solution in place?

Does the network device continue operating normally?

Is the overwriting of audit logs disabled?

Do application accounts share home directories?
Do application accounts share their primary group with non-application groups?
Do application processes run under unique application accounts?
Do application processes run under GID 0?

Do users own their user account's home directory?
Is file sharing restricted by group privileges?

csi:question.csi:qText: Are approved security tools used to manage password files?
Are approved security tools used to manage authentication?

Are users required to 'su' or 'sudo' into root?

Does root access require dual-factor authentication?
Do search paths for superuser contain the current working directory?
Are service configuration files located in appropriate system directories?
Is permission to edit service configuration files restricted to authorized personnel?
Is a process in place to document file system implementations that are different from the standard build?
Are permissions for device special files restricted to the owner?
Is Write access to account home directories restricted to owner and root?
Are remote access tools that do not require authentication (e.g.: rhost, shost, etc.) allowed?
Is access to modify startup and shutdown scripts restricted to root-level users?
Is a time synchronization protocol used (e.g.: NTP)?
Are UNIX servers periodically monitored for continued compliance to security requirements?
Are 'out of compliance' conditions reported and resolved?
Are UNIX servers periodically spot-checked to ensure they are in compliance with server build standards?
Does the OS log and audit attempts to gain access?

csi:question.csi:qText: Are user rights set to only allow access to those with a business need?
Are account options set to minimize unauthorized use or change of account content or status?
Are device options set to minimize unauthorized access or use?
Are domain options set to use encryption, signing, and machine password change management?
Are interactive logon options configured to minimize unauthorized access or use?
Are Microsoft network client and server options set to use encryption and digital signing?
Is the system configured to restrict anonymous connections (i.e. RestrictAnonymous registry setting)?

Is the Job Entry Subsystem protected?
Are SNA and TCP/IP mainframe networks protected?
Is the transfer of confidential data encrypted?
Does network monitoring software use a security interface?
Are transaction, commands, databases, and resources protected?
Is authentication required for access to any transaction or database system?
Is connection security in place for databases and transaction systems?
Does monitoring software for transaction and database systems use a security interface?
Are resource access, transmission links, and security interfaces active for data transport systems?
Are job scheduling systems secured to control the submission of production jobs into the environment?
Do storage management personnel have privileged authorities to mainframe systems?
Is the use of data transfer products secured?
Does archived data still possess the same controls as it did prior to archival?
Are security interfaces for systems monitoring software always active?
Are Unix Systems Services secured on the mainframe?
Are ESM (RACF) and inherent security configuration settings configured to support the Access Control Standards and requirements?
Are periodic checks performed to validate compliance with documented standards?
Are 'out of compliance' conditions reported and resolved?
Are group profile assignments based on employee role?
Do group profile assignments undergo an approval process?
Are user profiles created with the principle of least privilege?
Do users have *SAVSYS Authority to do saves and restores?

Is authority to run AS/400 configuration commands restricted to administrative-level users?
Is the QSYS library the first library in the library list?
Are users restricted from signing on the system from more than one workstation?
Is public authority set to *Exclude for Sensitive Commands?
Is access to Library List commands on production AS/400 systems restricted to appropriate users?
Has authority *PUBLIC to the QPWFSERVER authorization list been revoked?
Are Security Exit Programs installed and functioning for server functions that provide an exit?
Are library-level and object-level protections on system libraries (Q-Libraries) shipped from the vendor implemented as to the vendor's specifications?
Is each library list constructed for a community of users?
Are Job Descriptions used to provide application-specific library lists to an application's user community?
Are objects configured to allow users access without requiring AS/400 Special Authorities?
Has the Security Audit Journal (QUADJRN) been created?
Is the size of the journal receivers defined in QUADJRN?
Are AS/400 systems periodically monitored to ensure continued compliance with the documented standards?
Are 'out of compliance' conditions reported and resolved?
Do system files and directories prevent the presence of unsecured user mail files?
Are UIC protections in place on VMS systems?
Are WORLD WRITE permissions ever allowed?

Are changes to the operating system's parameters alarmed and audited?

Are VMS systems periodically monitored for continued compliance to documented standards?
Are 'out of compliance' conditions reported and resolved?
Is IIS configured to perform auditing and logging to support incident and access research?
Is anonymous access to FTP disabled?

Does each website have its own dedicated virtual directory structure?

Are unnecessary services turned off on IIS servers?
Do IIS services run on standard ports?
Are all sample applications and scripts removed?
Is least privilege used when setting IIS content permissions?
Is the IIS content folder on the same drive as the operating system?
Is Apache configured to perform auditing and logging to support incident and access research?
Is anonymous access to FTP disabled?
Is membership to the Apache group restricted to those with web administration roles and responsibilities?
Does each website have its own dedicated virtual directory structure?
Are Apache configuration options restricted to authorized users?
Do Apache services run on standard ports?
Are all sample applications and scripts removed?
Is least privilege used when setting Apache permissions?

Do freeware or shareware applications require approval from security prior to installation?
Does the use or installation of open source software (e.g.: Linux, Apache, etc.) undergo an information security review and approval process?

Can PCs not managed by the company connect directly into the company network?

Are laptop computers required to be physically locked when unattended?
Are laptops required to be attended at all times when in public places?
Are laptops required to be secured at all times when outside the organization's facilities?

csi:question.csi:qText: Are regular penetration tests executed against web-based applications?

Does your company have an Incident Management policy?
Has it been approved by management?
Has it been communicated to appropriate constituents?
Is an owner assigned who is responsible for the maintenance and review of the policy?
Does your company have a formal information security Incident Response Program / Plan?
Is there a documented process in place to report security incidents?
Is there a documented process in place to report any observed or suspected security weaknesses?
Is there a security incident response team with clearly defined and documented roles and responsibilities?
Have the incident response teams received incident-response related training or qualifications?
In the event of an incident, is the incident response team available 24x7x365?
Is the Incident Response Plan tested at least annually?

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: Does the Incident Response Plan include documented procedures for the following steps:
Have the following types of incidents been considered in the Incident Response Plan:

csi:question.csi:qText: Information system failures or loss of service
Does the Incident Response Plan require the notification of customers in the event of an incident?
Is an Incident Response contact list or calling tree maintained?
Is documentation maintained on previous incidents, outcomes and issues and their remediation?
Is there a managed process in place for developing and maintaining business continuity?
Is there a designated individual or group responsible for oversight and administration of the business recovery policy, plan, and program?
Does the company have formal governance body for business continuity?
Does senior management, an officer in the company or the board approve the business continuity plan?

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: Have the following in the BCP been reviewed within the past twelve months:

csi:question.csi:qText: Has an independent audit been completed on the business continuity plan?
Does your company have a written policy for business continuity and disaster recovery?
Has it been approved by management?
Has it been communicated to all constituents?
Is an owner assigned who is responsible for the maintenance and review of the policy?

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: Does the Business Continuity and/or Disaster Recovery plan address the following elements:

csi:question.csi:qText: Actions to be taken following an incident that jeopardizes business operations and/or human life
Fallback procedures that describe actions to be taken to move essential business activities
Resumption procedures to return to normal business operations
A maintenance schedule that specifies how/when the plan is to be tested
Roles and responsibilities describing who is responsible for executing aspects of the plan

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: Does the Business Continuity and/or Disaster Recovery Policy require the following:

csi:question.csi:qText: Specifies roles and responsibilities relative to planning, testing, oversight, administration, and accountability?
A risk assessment to be performed for processes to be included in the plan?
Identification of threats and vulnerabilities relative to people, facilities, and technology?
Completion of a Business Impact Analysis?
Escalation procedures and the incident declaration process?
Identification of escalation procedures for third parties service providers and subcontractors?
Establishment of parameters and requirements for periodic testing of recovery plans and procedures based on risk?
Evaluation of testing results and remediation of deficiencies and inadequacies?

Periodic review with management of the status of the business recovery planning program and enhancement to adjust for changes in organization, technology, processes, environmental and regulatory factors?
Implementation of a change management process to ensure changes are replicated to contingency environments?

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: Does the risk assessment process address all areas of risk, including:
Does the Business Impact Analysis address the following:

csi:question.csi:qText: Business Process Criticality (i.e., High, Medium or Low; Numerical Rating) that distinguishes the relative importance of each process

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: Does the Disaster Recovery Plan address the following:

csi:question.csi:qText: Composition and responsibilities of Emergency Response Team?
Escalation procedures for different levels of emergency?
Identification of dependencies upon third parties including utilities and service providers?
Identification of vital records, tools, processes and vendors?
Is there a designated command center where management can meet, organize, and conduct emergency operations?

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: At what frequency does the business continuity plan undergo:

csi:question.csi:qText: A full scope test: Every 3 months?
A full scope test: Every 6 months?
A full scope test: Every 12 months?
A full scope test: Every 24 months?
A full scope test: More than 24 months?
A full scope test: Only when requested?
A partial scope test: Every 3 months?
A partial scope test: Every 6 months?
A partial scope test: Every 12 months?
A partial scope test: Every 24 months?
A partial scope test: More than 24 months?
A partial scope test: Only when requested?
Is the business continuity plan tested after each major upgrade, change or modification to corporate infrastructure?

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: Does the Test Plan:

csi:question.csi:qText: Define the scope of the test and test objectives relative to technology outage, loss of facility or personnel?
Assess the ability to retrieve vital records?
Document the results of the testing including completion of objectives, test failures, deficiencies found and recovery issues?
Identify remediation steps and follow-up actions?
Receive a regular update from the inventory of IT and telecom assets?
Require changes to be replicated to backup facilities?
Require a post-event analysis or lessons-learned discussion?
Were alternative sites included in the testing?

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: Does the Test Plan ensure that the following information for critical vendors and service providers is documented:

csi:question.csi:qText: List of key personnel and alternates?

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: Contact information including:

csi:question.csi:qText: Is there a process in place to track, prioritize and bring to closure outstanding issues in an agreed upon timeframe.
Are clients involved in test exercises?
Are subcontractors involved in test exercises?
Do dependent service providers participate in test exercises?
Is documentation maintained on historical test objectives, outcomes and issues and their remediation?
Is the backup server/computer facility provided internally? (If not, note the service provider in the "Additional Information" column)
If a service provider is used, are the recovery services dedicated?
Does the backup processing facility have electrical power supplied via a UPS system and emergency power generators?
Are communications links to and from the backup recovery facility maintained and tested as part of the ongoing disaster recovery testing?
Does the recovery site use a different power grid and telecommunications grid from those used by the primary site?
Does the company have insurance coverage for business interruptions or general services interruption regardless of the reason?
Does the company have insurance coverage pertaining to specific products and services provided to the Receiving Company?

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: Is your organization required to comply with the following legal and regulatory requirements:
Is your organization performing independent audits to ensure compliance with the following legal and regulatory requirements:

csi:question.csi:qText: Are procedures in place to capture cleartext messages sent by constituents who are subject to SEC regulations?

csi:questionGroup.csi:qText: If so, are the following addressed:
Within the last year, has there been an independent review of the company's security policies, standards, procedures, and guidelines by the following:
If so, indicate the scope of the review:

csi:question.csi:qText: Line of business operational procedures and standards
Information technology operational procedures and standards
Has a network penetration test been conducted within the last year?
Does the organization undergo a SAS 70 Type II examination at least annually?
Have remediation plans been developed for all identified exceptions?
